message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SE, cs.PL, cs.SY, cs.AI 

This paper discusses the development of a novel hybrid test input generation approach to improve dynamic analysis of Android apps. The paper focuses on the detection of Android malware, which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The approach involves integrating a random-based tool (Monkey) with a state-based tool (DroidBot) to improve code coverage and uncover more malicious behaviors. This integration involves software engineering (cs.SE) and programming languages (cs.PL) concepts. The use of state-based methods also involves system engineering (cs.SY) concepts. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of machine learning techniques to classify the apps as benign or malware, which falls under the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
